instructions:
In a wide pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic, tomatoes and red pepper flakes. Season
lightly with salt and pepper. Let cook for a few minutes until tomatoes start to soften. Then using a
potato-masher mash the tomatoes. Cook 20 -25 minutes until sauce thickens. Bring a large pot of salted
water to a boil and cook spaghetti until shy of a dente. Reserve a little pasta water. Drain pasta and add
pasta to the sauce, cook over medium-high heat gently tossing pasta. Add some of the reserved pasta
water if sauce is too thick. Take pan off heat add in butter, cheese and basil. This goes well with a nice
Italian sausage on the side.
ingredients: 20 ripe plum tomatoes peeled halved & seeded
1/2 cup freshly ground Parmigiano Reggiano cheese
name: Spaghetti With Fresh Tomatoes & Basil
